tournament.name: Bazaar of Boxes Series 16 | CardCon 2025 Edition

decks.notes: This control deck focuses on using a variety of counter spells and removal spells to control the board while using card draw and ramp spells to maintain card advantage and secure the late game. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Quantum Riddler to generate additional value and pressure opponents. With a mana base that includes key lands like Karakas and Tundra, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while disrupting opponent's plays with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to help finish off opponents. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps filter draws, while Mishra's Bauble and cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder ensure consistency and smooth gameplay. The mana base is optimized for fast mana development and color fixing.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card draw and filtering, while disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will protect the combo. The deck also includes tempo cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower to slow down opponents. The mana base features a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's colors. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently reanimate big threats and disrupt opponents' game plans.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using powerful cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will, along with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes land disruption with Wasteland to slow down the opponent's mana development.

This deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a board presence with efficient and disruptive creatures. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial, Swords to Plowshares, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the game and eliminate threats. The creatures in the deck, such as Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition, provide additional disruption to the opponent's board while also putting pressure on them. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting the spells needed to maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to use mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to power out big threats like Reality Smasher and It That Heralds the End. With a mix of disruptive elements and powerful creatures, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The land base is also focused on optimizing mana production for Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up to Omniscience through cards like Lotus Petal and Show and Tell, allowing the player to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Stock Up provide card draw and filtering to help find key pieces of the combo. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Lórien Revealed provide additional utility to the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing various ways to get creatures into the graveyard quickly, such as Entomb and Thoughtseize, in order to bring them back with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows for powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to be put into play early and dominate the game. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and disruption spells like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. The lands are optimized for color fixing and consistency in casting spells.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and removal to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a combination of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal spells, the deck aims to control the board and the opponent's resources. The deck also includes card draw and card selection to ensure consistency in finding key pieces. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional value and versatility. Additionally, using graveyard hate like Nihil Spellbomb and Cling to Dust helps to disrupt opponent strategies reliant on the graveyard.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Blightsteel Colossus, Griselbrand, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes strong control elements like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Brainstorm to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Lim-Dûl's Vault and Ponder help to dig for key cards while cards like Lotus Petal provide mana acceleration. Keen Duelist and Parker Luck add a unique twist to the deck by providing additional interaction and opportunities for advantageous combat situations.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells, using powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to push for damage. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the three colors of mana needed for the deck, with land destruction cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Additionally, Goblin Bombardment can be used as a finisher, sacrificing creatures for direct damage to the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use the cards Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes other disruptive spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and multiple cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the needed pieces. Additionally, cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Stock Up provide additional support and versatility to the deck. The mana base is optimized to support the combo while providing flexibility.

The main concept of this deck is to use various fast mana sources and card draw spells to quickly assemble the pieces needed for a game-winning storm combo. The deck aims to set up a large storm count, generate a lot of mana, and then finish the game with a Tendrils of Agony or other lethal spell. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman and Burning Wish allows for additional versatility and toolbox options, while cards like Duress and Thoughtseize help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is built to be fast, efficient, and resilient against disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets, while also disrupting their game plan through counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to maintain tempo advantage by controlling the board with removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, while also ensuring card advantage and deck manipulation through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm. This strategy allows the deck to efficiently close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to swiftly deal damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board while protecting its creatures with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. Mishra's Bauble and cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder help maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws. Wasteland disrupts the opponent's mana base while the mana base of Island','','');">Volcanic Island and fetch lands provide the necessary colors to cast spells efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets while protecting them with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board. Mishra's Bauble is used for card advantage and to fuel Dragon's Rage Channeler's ability. The deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Surgical Extraction. Overall, it's a fast-paced aggro deck that aims to win through tempo and efficiency.
